business.headline: Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

Ola Electric shares nosedive 10% after Q4 net loss. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ola Electric's Q4 numbers have laid bare the challenges facing India's EV poster child, from falling volumes and margin pressures to delays in execution. While the company's aggressive bets on electric motorcycles and rural expansion could pay off, the near-term outlook is murky.

Mazagon Dock shares snap winning streak, tumble 8%. Here's whyThe stock fell to an intraday low of Rs 3,450, retracing from Thursday's close of Rs 3,749. Around 10:07 am, shares of the company were trading 4.75% lower at Rs 3,574.40.

Suzlon Energy share price up 13% over strong Q4 results: Should you buy?Suzlon Energy stock price: The shares jumped as much as 13% in early trade, reaching an intraday high of Rs 74.30 on the BSE. This rise comes after Suzlon Energy Ltd announced a sharp rise in its quarterly profit.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy shares rose 13% after Q4 resultsThe sharp rally came after Suzlon posted a 365% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit for Q4FY25. Profit rose to Rs 1,182 crore from Rs 254 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased 73% to Rs 3,773 crore, compared to Rs 2,179 crore in the year-ago period.
Sensex opens 150 points lower; Nifty below 24,800; Infosys down over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 45.58 points to 81,587.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 24.20 points to 24,857.80 as of 9:25 am.

Prostarm Info Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusProstarm Info Systems was subscribed to nearly 100 times. The IPO opened for subscription on May 27, 2025, and closed on May 29, 2025.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher today. Here's whyAt 8:14 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,950, suggesting a positive start above Thursday's Nifty50 close of 24,833.6. This indicates that markets may open with gains in early trade.

Stocks to watch on May 30: LIC, Baja Auto, Ola, Nykaa, Mazagaon Dock, IndiGoAs the week nears its end, investors will be looking out for key movements on Friday, May 30, especially as several companies are expected to release their quarterly earnings.
Elf beauty buys Hailey Bieber's Rhode in $1 billion dealElf will acquire Rhode for $600 million in cash and $200 million of newly issued shares of Elf Beauty common stock.

Mumbai's Dharavi to get a Rs 95,790 crore makeover in 7 yearsThe redevelopment is being led by a special purpose vehicle (SPV), Navbharat Mega Developers Private Limited (NMDPL), formed through a joint venture between the Maharashtra government's Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) and the Adani Group's Dharavi Redevelopment Project Private Limited (DRPPL).

entertainment.headline: Actors Divya Spandana, Vinodhini back Kamal Haasan in Kannada rowKamal Haasan found himself in the middle of a controversy after his 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' remark caused uproar among Kannadigas. While he is facing backlash from pro-Kannada groups, actors Divya Spandana and Vinodhini Vaidyanathan have expressed their thoughts on the same.

Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda debut in YRF's Saiyaara, an intense love storyThe teaser of 'Saiyaara' marking the debut of Ananya Panday's cousin Ahaan is out. The film, directed by Mohit Suri, will release in theatres on July 18.

Justin Bieber reacts as wife Hailey's Rhode brand hits $1 Billion ValuationModel Hailey Bieber's skincare brand, Rhode, was acquired by e.l.f. Beauty for $1 billion. Her husband and singer Justin Bieber showed his quiet support to his wife.

Anushka-Virat's sweet moment after RCB win, actor celebrates team's victory. WatchAnushka Sharma was on cloud nine after husband-cricketer Virat Kohli's RCB team defeated PBKS and secured their spot in Qualifier one of IPL 2025. Take a look at the celebratory videos here.

Sumona Chakravarti enjoys sun, beach, bikini on Bali holiday, shares vibrant picsActor Sumona Chakravarti posted a few photos on Instagram, in which she could be seen making the most of her downtime at a beach in Bali.

I'm making amends for a bad film, so I present Thug Life: Kamal Haasan at eventKamal Haasan hinted at the failure of 'Indian 2' at the Visakhapatnam event of his upcoming film, 'Thug Life'. He said that he was making amends for giving a bad film.

Ajay Devgn sets the record straight on daughter Nysa's Bollywood debutActor Ajay Devgn answered a question about the possibility of daughter Nysa Devgan's Bollywood debut. He was accompanied by his wife, actor Kajol, at the trailer launch of 'Maa'.

Suhana Khan, Gauri host bash for AbRam's 12th birthday. SRK, Aryan give a missShah Rukh Khan and Gauri Khan's son AbRam turned 12 on May 27. Garui and his sister Suhana Khan hosted a cute birthday bash for him. However, SRK and Aryan Khan were missing.

8 films, 30 years: How Mission films became Tom Cruise's greatest adventureActor-producer Tom Cruise took a nostalgic trip down memory lane, sharing throwback photos from eight 'Mission Impossible' films. He called it an 'adventure of a lifetime'.

Sean Diddy's ex-assistant accuses him of sexual assault in court testimonySean "Diddy" Combs faces fresh rape claims in his ongoing sex trafficking trial. Ex-assistant "Mia" and singer Cassie testify to years of abuse and coercion.

Shakira, Jason Aldean Fenway Park concerts cancelled hours before showShakira and Jason Aldean's Fenway Park concerts cancelled hours before showtime due to unforeseen circumstances, sparking fan outrage and refund chaos.

Love Island USA season 7 cast revealedPeacock reveals 10 bold new contestants for Love Island USA Season 7, premiering June 3. Set in Fiji, the series returns with fresh faces, drama, and romance six days a week.

Rakul Preet reacts to buzz around Virat Kohli's like on Avneet Kaur's postActor Rakul Preet Singh has reacted to the ongoing speculation over Indian cricketer Virat Kohli accidentally liking Avneet Kaur's post.

Karan Johar gets trolled by his twins over pouty selfies. WatchKaran Johar was hilariously trolled by his twins, Yash and Roohi, in an Instagram video. From gifting hugs to mocking his pouty selfies, the adorable exchange left fans laughing out loud.

Bharti Singh battles recurring fever, urges fans to improve lifestyle habitComedian Bharti Singh revealed she has been battling recurring fevers and weakness since returning from a work trip to Bangkok. Currently, she is undergoing several medical tests.

Johny Lever reacts to Paresh Rawal's exit from Hera Pheri 3Johny Lever has reacted to Paresh Rawal's sudden exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. He urged both the actors and the makers of the film to resolve the matter.

Exclusive: No Puri Jagannadh film with Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu, says Radhika ApteRadhika Apte's 'Sister Midnight' is finally releasing in India after a hiatus. She clarifies false rumours about her upcoming projects while revealing plans to direct a Marathi film.

Ajay Devgn and Kajol support 8-hour work shifts for new mothers in film industryAjay Devgn and Kajol support the demand for 8-hour work shifts for new mothers in the film industry, saying the change is being accepted by many. They spoke about it during the trailer launch of their upcoming film 'Maa'.

Ileana D'Cruz radiates pregnancy glow as she flaunts baby bump in new picActor Ileana D'Cruz is expecting her second child with husband Michael Dolan, whom she married in 2023. She shared a sweet 'bump buddies' photo on Instagram, confirming the news.

general news.headline: Destroyed Pak air bases in minutes, this is strength of new India: PMDestroyed Pak air bases in few minutes, this is strength of new India: PM

Major problem, finally put to end: Congress leader praises Article 370 abrogationCongress leader Salman Khurshid, while interacting with a delegation in Indonesia, said the abrogation of Article 370 put an end to the perception that Jammu and Kashmir was a separate entity.

Pakistan's PR: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi, Revanth Reddy over Rafale remarksBJP leaders Amit Malviya and Sambit Patra slammed Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Revanth Reddy for questioning alleged Rafale losses during Operation Sindoor. They accused Congress of echoing Pakistan's line and undermining India's armed forces.

Befriend, rape, blackmail: The MO of 'love jihad' gangs in BhopalThe modus operandi of these 'love jihad gangs' involve befriending unsuspecting Hindu girls, sexually exploiting them and then blackmailing them with obscene videos. A woman sub-inspector was among those trapped.

Why users feel Ola, Uber, Rapido's advance tipping is grossly unfairOla Cabs, Uber and Rapido's advance-tipping feature, using which users can ensure that they get a ride by paying a tip in advance, has come under government scrutiny over fair practices. Users have been slamming it too, calling it grossly unfair. Here's what the complaints are about.

Ex-BJP leader's son, 2 others convicted of killing Uttarakhand hotel receptionistThe Kotdwar court convicted Pulkit Arya, son of a former BJP leader, and two others in the 2022 Ankita Bhandari murder case after a 14-month trial.

Disappointed: Shashi Tharoor on Colombia condemning Pak deaths after Op SindoorOn a five-nation tour, Shashi Tharoor told Colombia there is no parity between terrorists and victims, criticising Bogota's condolence message for Pakistani casualties after India's Operation Sindoor.

History books are wrong, Jodha-Akbar marriage a lie: Rajasthan GovernorRajasthan Governor Haribhau Bagade claimed that the marriage between Akbar and 'Jodha Bai' is a British-influenced historical fabrication, not mentioned in the Akbarnama.

I'm making amends for a bad film, so I present Thug Life: Kamal Haasan at eventKamal Haasan hinted at the failure of 'Indian 2' at the Visakhapatnam event of his upcoming film, 'Thug Life'. He said that he was making amends for giving a bad film.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

PM's stark message to 'paltu rams' in Bihar: Reduces your significanceIn a meeting with Bihar BJP leaders, Prime Minister Narendra Modi warned leaders against switching camps just before polls and then returning to the original party.
Are you being soft-dumped? Plus, what to do if you areMany people indulge in soft dumping in the hope that the other person will get the 'hint' or that the relationship will dissolve on its own.

Did you see that coming? RCB ditch the drama with ice-cold nerves in Qualifier 1IPL 2025: RCB turned back years of painful playoff collapses with a performance that was all poise, no panic in the Qualifier 1 win over Punjab Kings. Ice in their veins, clarity in their plans and now, just one win away from rewriting history.

4 killed, 27 injured in Punjab firecracker factory blast; several feared trappedFour migrant workers died and around 27 were injured in a blast at a firecracker factory in Punjab's Sri Muktsar Sahib. The cause of the explosion is under investigation.

Trump lashes out at US federal court over tariff ruling: It is purely hatredIn his social media post, Donald Trump said that the US Court of International Trade's order to block import tariffs was "so wrong" and "so political".

Did Virat Kohli call Musheer Khan waterboy in IPL Qualifier 1? Fans slam RCB starIPL 2025, Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli faced backlash for allegedly calling debutant Musheer Khan a 'waterboy' during IPL 2025 Qualifier 1, sparking criticism over his on-field behaviour. RCB defeated PBKS to qualify for the final for the first time in nine years.

Eliminator: Captain Shubman faces first big Test against resurgent MIIPL 2025 Eliminator, GT vs MI: Shubman Gill will be facing his first big test as a captain when Gujarat Titans take on Mumbai Indians in the Eliminator of the Indian Premier League 2025. All eyes will be on Gill, and if he will be able to perform in a high-pressure game.

Pakistan's terror nexus exposed: Ministers share stage with LeT commandersFrom glorifying Pahalgam attack accused Saifullah Kasuri to Hafiz Saeed's son Talha sharing stage with government ministers, Kasur rally exposes Pakistan's deep state-terror nexus.

Swiss glacier collapse: How climate change is weakening glacial glue of the AlpsSwiss glaciologists warn that rising temperatures are destabilising permafrost, which typically holds rocks and glaciers in place.

Apologise to Karnataka IAS officer: Court to lawmaker for 'Pakistani' remarkKarnataka High Court orally asked BJP MLC Ravikumar to apologise for calling IAS officer Fouzia Taranum a "Pakistani". Congress MLC delegation on Thursday met Governor Thawarchand Gehlot demanding legal action against Ravikumar.

Where fantasy fights real-life demons: Revisiting A Korean Odyssey after 8 years'A Korean Odyssey', a 2017 show, remains powerful today for its timeless mix of fantasy, emotional depth, and social critique. Not just a love story, it explores loneliness, power, and sacrifice with rich characters and stunning visuals.

He'll always be with us: Trump to 'terrific' Elon Musk as he exits his teamUS President Donald Trump praised Elon Musk as "terrific" as the billionaire stepped down from DOGE, ending a controversial tenure marked by federal cuts, legal challenges, and backlash over his political alignments.

K Kavitha slams BRS after letter to father leaked, may float new partyMLC K Kavitha, upset over a leaked letter to father and BRS chief K Chandrshekar Rao, has accused party insiders of weakening the party. She also warned against a BJP merger and hinted she may start a new political party.

ISI-trained 'spy' who sent Indian SIM cards to Pakistan arrested in RajasthanThe officials stated that Kasim visited Pakistan twice in the last one year, staying for about 90 days in total, and received espionage training from ISI handlers and senior operatives.

sports.headline: Can Rohit Sharma break his playoff jinx? MI face big questions ahead of EliminatorMumbai Indians will need their hitman, Rohit Sharma, to score big as they take on Gujarat Titans in the Eliminator fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Rohit has had a mixed season so far as he has scored 329 runs from 13 innings at an average of 27.41 and a strike rate of 147.53.

India announce squad for historic mixed disability IT20 Series in EnglandThe Indian men's mixed disability team is set to face England in a seven-match IT20I series, starting June 21. Taunton, Wormsley, Worcester, Bristol and Lord's will host the matches.

IPL Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 floors AB de VilliersAB de Villiers was in awe of Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 as RCB reached the final of the IPL 2025 season. Kohli was lively on the field for RCB as they thrashed PBKS to reach the final.

Chasing 150-160 would have been tough: Josh HazlewoodIPL 2025, Qualifier 1, PBKS vs RCB: Josh Hazlewood said that the Royal Challengers Bengaluru would have struggled had Punjab Kings set a target in the range of 150 and 160 in Mullanpur. RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets on Thursday and secured their berth in the final.

Did you see that coming? RCB ditch the drama with ice-cold nerves in Qualifier 1IPL 2025: RCB turned back years of painful playoff collapses with a performance that was all poise, no panic in the Qualifier 1 win over Punjab Kings. Ice in their veins, clarity in their plans and now, just one win away from rewriting history.

Sunil Gavaskar tips 'focused and mature' RCB to win IPL after crushing PBKSLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar praised Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) for their subdued celebrations after a thumping win over Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Qualifier 1 and backed them to win the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

French Open Day 6: Swiatek, Alcaraz, Sabalenka set for Round 3French Open 2025, Day 6 Order of Play: Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and others will aim for a berth in the fourth round when they take the court on Friday, May 30. Yuki Bhambri and Rohan Bopanna will also in action.

PBKS looked in too much of a hurry, RCB fully deserve to be in final: GavaskarLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar said that Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) put up an all-around show in the Qualifier 1 fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Punjab Kings. RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets to qualify for the IPL final for the fourth time in their history.

Are Gujarat Titans equipped enough for playoffs without Jos Buttler?IPL 2025: With Jos Buttler returning to national duty for England's limited-overs series against the West Indies, the Gujarat Titans will need to put on their thinking caps to identify the right fit for the crucial No. 3 spot heading into the playoffs.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem qualifies for final with massive throwPakistan's Arshad Nadeem, returning after the Paris Olympics last year, threw 86.34 metres and qualified for the final of the Asian Athletics Championships javelin.

Did Punjab Kings go overboard with their intent in Qualifier 1 loss to RCB?Punjab Kings' approach of going hard backfired massively in the Qualifier 1 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. But was it the approach or the shot-making that led to the downfall of the Kings in Mullanpur?

French Open Day 6: Swiatek, Alcaraz, Sabalenka set for Round 3French Open 2025, Day 6 Order of Play: Iga Swiatek, Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and others will aim for a berth in the fourth round when they take the court on Friday, May 30. Yuki Bhambri and Rohan Bopanna will also in action.

RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets to qualify for the IPL final for the fourth time in their history.

Are Gujarat Titans equipped enough for playoffs without Jos Buttler?IPL 2025: With Jos Buttler returning to national duty for England's limited-overs series against the West Indies, the Gujarat Titans will need to put on their thinking caps to identify the right fit for the crucial No. 3 spot heading into the playoffs.

Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem qualifies for final with massive throwPakistan's Arshad Nadeem, returning after the Paris Olympics last year, threw 86.34 metres and qualified for the final of the Asian Athletics Championships javelin.

Did Punjab Kings go overboard with their intent in Qualifier 1 loss to RCB?Punjab Kings' approach of going hard backfired massively in the Qualifier 1 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. But was it the approach or the shot-making that led to the downfall of the Kings in Mullanpur?

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
